abstract: General Motors‘ chief executive, Edward E. Whitacre Jr., continued remaking the management ranks Monday, naming Christopher P. Liddell from Microsoft to be chief financial officer and a vice chairman.
snippet: General Motors‘ chief executive, Edward E. Whitacre Jr., continued remaking the management ranks Monday, naming Christopher P. Liddell from Microsoft to be chief financial officer and a vice chairman.
lead_paragraph: General Motors interim chief executive, Edward E. Whitacre Jr., continued his hurry-up offense approach to remaking the management ranks Monday, naming Christopher P. Liddell, who led a recent $3 billion cost-cutting effort at Microsoft, as its chief financial officer and a vice chairman, The New York Times’s Nick Bunkley reported.

headline.main: G.M. Hires Finance Chief From Microsoft

abstract: Google is nearing a deal to buy the start-up Docverse, TechCrunch reported, citing unidentified sources. The deal is said to be worth about $25 million, and is just one of a series that the Internet giant is making as it challenges Microsoft for dominance in the word processing sector.
snippet: Google is nearing a deal to buy the start-up Docverse, TechCrunch reported, citing unidentified sources. The deal is said to be worth about $25 million, and is just one of a series that the Internet giant is making as it challenges Microsoft for d...
lead_paragraph: Google is nearing a deal to buy the start-up Docverse, TechCrunch reported, citing unidentified sources. The deal is said to be worth about $25 million, and is just one of a series that the Internet giant is making as it challenges Microsoft for dominance in the word-processing sector.

headline.main: Many Small Buys as Google Assails Office
